property.en:
Help

Summary. View a summary of the Properties tab information.

Property|Value. Shows property and value for every pair.

Help

Filters. Filter available properties.

  • Filter Property: - Lists the available properties.
  • Operator: – Lists the operations available for the above property.
  • Value(s): - Allows you to input conditions for the operation.
  • Blank: - Check the box to return results with the value or a blank (null).
  • Param: – Check the box to allow users to modify the parameter from the report viewer.

Help

Reports. View all existing reports, save a new report, and save an existing report with a new name.

Help

Preview. View your report. Click on the column headings to sort in ascending or descending order.

Help

Style. Set colors for the border, header, item and alternating item. Click Set Default to restore system defaults.

Help

Properties. Add and delete properties from your selected item types. Sort the properties and perform sort and perform functions

  • Property: Lists all properties available from the tables and views selected in Item Types.
  • Description: Describes the property. Defaults to property name, but can be edited.
  • Sort A: Sort by the selected Property.
  • Sort D: Sort by the selected Description.
  • VG: Visually groups the properties in your report.
  • A: Allows you to add, subtract, multiply, or divide by the selection in the row above. Click the box to.
  • Function: Allows you to perform a function on the selected Property.
  • Format: Allows you to format the selected Property.

You can add a summary line to all numeric properties using:

  • Avg – the average of the properties
  • Count – counts how many
  • Count Distinct – counts everything only once
  • Min value – Minimum value of the total
  • Maximum value – Maximum value of the total
  • Sum – Adds the total

Property|Value. Shows property and value for every pair.

Help

Chart. Create a chart for your report.

Pie: Select the Label and its corresponding function and the Value and its corresponding function. Click Sort A to indicate which one to sort by. Show as a 3D graphic, explode the largest slice, and select between a pie or a doughnut.

Trend: Select the Date and its corresponding function and the Value and its corresponding function. Click Sort A to indicate which one to sort by.

Plot: Select the X and Y values and click Sort A to indicate which one to sort by.

Bar chart: Select the Label and its corresponding function and the Value and its corresponding function. Click Sort A to indicate which one to sort by.

Help

Misc.  Add a title, report description header and footer.

Help

Gauge. Guages can be used to build dashboards and help users visualize critical performance data. Place the property that describes what you are measuring and a value that contains the value.
